definitions.definition: Done with intensity or to a great degree ; thorough .

subdefinitions.definition: Of agriculture : increasing the productivity of an area of land .
Of a word : serving to give emphasis or force .

definitions.definition: Involving much activity in a short period of time ; highly concentrated .
examples: I took a three-day intensive course in finance.

definitions.definition: Of or pertaining to innate or internal intensity or strength rather than outward extent .
Chiefly suffixed to a noun : using something with intensity; requiring a great amount of something; demanding .
examples: This job is difficult because it is so labour- intensive .

subdefinitions.definition: Chiefly in intensive care : of care or treatment : involving a great degree of life support , monitoring , and other forms of effort in order to manage life-threatening conditions .
examples: She was moved to the intensive -care unit of the hospital.

subdefinitions.definition: That can be intensified; allowing an increase of degree.
Synonym of intense ( “ extreme or very high or strong in degree; of feelings , thoughts , etc.: strongly focused ” ) .

main_definition: Done with intensity or to a great degree ; thorough .
secondary_definitions: Involving much activity in a short period of time ; highly concentrated .
Of or pertaining to innate or internal intensity or strength rather than outward extent .
Chiefly suffixed to a noun : using something with intensity; requiring a great amount of something; demanding .
